NAEB PLACEMENT SERVICE
Anyone wishing to register with the NAEB Placement Service should write to Mr. Rob¬
ert Underwood, Jr., 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois, and the proper forms will
be forwarded to you by return mail. Also, any inquiries concerning applicants
listed below should be addressed to Mr. Underwood.
The following descriptions of personnel listed with us are written by the appli¬
cants themselves, and are taken directly ffom the Placement Service forms.
Dec. 1. Experienced announcer, director, producer, now in commercial recording,
wishes to return to TV. Desires position demanding good work, but giving responsi¬
bility and freedom of execution. Two years of ”on camera” work as commercial an¬
nouncer, supplemented by responsibility of completely producing many of shows han¬
dled. Proficient technician who can also think.
Dec. 2. Man desires position in educational TV. B.S. in speech and radio. M.S. in
administration and supervision. Seven years educational and commercial experience
in radio, TV, audio-visual instruction and motion picture production and distribu¬
tion. Licensed in New York State as teacher and supervisor.. Presently employed in
motion picture production and distribution work. Available immediately.
Dec. 3. Available for immediate employment. Young man, 35, wants position in ETV.
Equipped byti&ining and experience to handle wide range of problems. Can fit into
any organization. Looking for opportunity to combine creative ability with tech¬
nical know-how in educational field.
Dec. 4. Age 30, seeks radio-TV position in New York. B.A. and M.A. degree. Exper¬
ience in commercial writing and teaching. Have good knowledge of music, theater,
^ and literature.
Dec. 5. I have been thoroughly trained in radio and television. My radio exper¬
ience includes announcing, programming, and management. Two educational programs
I produced received national citations from the Ohio Institute. I am looking for
a challenging position with an organization interested in or active in television.
Dec. 6. Production, script, research. Versatile young woman with commercial sta¬
tion and network experience in informational and cultural programming. A.B. with
distinction, Cornell.
Dec. 7. Are extra hands needed in your station’s OPERATION? Do you want a person
who is creative, capable, energetic, enthusiastic, loyal and willing to work? A
person who is experienced and well trained in all aspects of broadcasting—program
planning and building, radio and TV writing, production, acting, announcing, audience
measurement and savoir faire?
Dec. 8. TV Workshop graduate, age 23, seeking apprentice position with TV station.
Able to work camera, dolly, cables, lighting, etc. Salary secondary. Will travel
if necessary.
Dec. 9. Woman desires position utilizing background and training in education and
TV. Taught English in secondary schools for 5 years. Recently completed graduate
course of study in radio-TV with M.S. degree. Single,36, references.
'
Dec. 10. Interested in getting located in the creative fields of television. My
B certificate from the summer institute of radio and TV of Barnard College and the
NBC attests to the fact that I am a person of ideas. I can be of valuable service
to any producer.
